name: The Salvation Cabinet
description: The Salvation Cabinet was formed by Sultan Ömer Faruk after he was brought to power by his loyal friends. This alliance is supposed to preserve democracy despite the defeat and save the Empire from the ambitions of the OHF.

name: Handle the OHF Leadership
description: The OHF has its predominant figures leading the country. Men like Ismet Pasha and Fevzi Pasha still follow the Kemalist ideals and try to continue the reforms implemented Mustafa Kemal Pasha. By arresting them for treason and endangering the nation, we can stop them before they have time to react.

name: Ban the OHF
description: The OHF is no more, its leaders are in prison and the government has stated its intention to reverse the reforms applied by Mustafa Kemal. It's now time to officially disband the party. Some deputies will be able to join the new and existing parties, while others have already fled.

name: Purge Internal Military Factions
description: When Fevzi Pasha and the other generals were arrested, many soldiers and NCOs rebelled and thus showed their allegiance to the OHF. The influence of the party on the army was obvious, but we didn't know it was capable of challenging our Coup. We need to...remove...everyone who puts loyalty to a party over loyalty to the army.

name: Investigate Kemalist Corruption
description: The political strategy of the OHF was based on the installation of officials loyal to the party throughout Turkey and the Empire in order to better centralise these regions. It is time to purge the administration of any who have ties to the OHF.

name: Repeal the Unification Decree
description: The Unification and Co-education decree, one of the greatest reforms taken by Mustafa Kemal, is seen by many conservatives in our coalition as an insult to Islam itself, whilst many liberals see in its centralist approach to education an attack on the Millet system and the initiative of private individuals. Let us do away with it.

name: Reestablish Democratic Plurality
description: The Empire had become an OHF-led dictatorship since the assassination attempts on Mustafa Kemal Pasha and the opening of the courts. However, despite the fact that the assembly is still dissolved, we must allow the parties to meet and express themselves freely again.

name: Reestablish the Millet System
description: The Millet System allowed each faith to possess a certain amount of autonomy and to not be discriminated against by the predominantly Muslim population. This secured them certain privileges in the eyes of the law. Although this system is not strictly egalitarian from the popular point of view, it is quite respectful of individual beliefs.

name: Revert Laws on Secularism
description: The OHF crafted numerous laws on secularism. Some view these laws as attacks on Islam, the Caliph and the traditional state religion, while others see them as violent blows against religious institutions and Sufist organisations. It is time to roll back these reforms in order to secure the support of the traditionalists.

name: Fatin Rüştü Economic Plan
description: Fatin Rüştü Bey is a young diplomat and a specialist in foreign relations and global liberalism. He studied in Germany, travelled extensively and was particularly active during the Black Monday financial crisis. His youth is synonymous with modernity and he is a supporter, along with some other economists, of a recovery plan centered on the use of foreign capital.

name: Attracting Investors
description: One of the first steps in our recovery plan is to make Turkey attractive to foreign capital again. The plan is to give favourable incentives, reconnect with major foreign markets and reopen our country to foreign investment.

name: Call Turkish Companies Home
description: Many Turkish companies had settled in the Middle East, but now they are endangered by the Arab powers and are reluctant to return to their homeland. Let's offer them subsidies in order to make them decide once and for all where they belong.

name: Take Out a Reconstruction Loan
description: In order for our economy to fully recover, we will have to take out an expensive loan from a big German or Canadian bank, which will help us revive the immobilised sectors and rebuild the national economy.

name: Reorganise National Infrastructure
description: The imperial infrastructure was increasingly designed to unite Anatolia and the Middle East in order to reduce inequality and strengthen national sentiment. However, with our defeat, we can now reorganise our infrastructure to make it more effective within our new borders.

name: An Anatolian Economy
description: Finally, the recovery is done and the economy of the empire refocused on Anatolia. This no longer makes us look like a vast empire crumbling under debt and on a precarious path but like a modern and united nation instead.

name: Restoring the Meclis-i Mebûsan
description: Finally, with the elimination of the OHF as a political force, the strengthening of the coalition, the confidence granted by the different parties and economic recovery on the way, we can restore the Meclis-i Mebûsan and show our people true democracy.

name: A New Sultan
description: Without a descendant of Osman I leading our nation into its future, the Empire is but a shadow of itself, and both the people and our politicians are well aware of this. Cries for the return of the house of Osmanoglu are growing ever louder, and it seems that it is about time for the provisional government to move on to its final task: crowning a new Sultan and restoring the monarchy to the throne.

name: More Power to the Meclis-i Mebûsan
description: The Meclis-i Mebûsan or Ottoman Assembly is the very organ of democracy but has been overly manipulated during the CUP and OHF governments. It is now responsible for leading the Turkish people to great heights, and as such should possess immutable power over the government and the Sultan.

name: More Power to the Sultan
description: Sultan Ömer has nothing in common with the previous sultans of the empire. He is not authoritarian like Abdulmecid II, nor is he puppet or defeated like his four predecessors. He is the image of a Turkish Sultan like those who ruled the Empire in times immemorial. Having restored democracy and having saved the empire from a catastrophic situation, the charismatic Sultan must have a role in politics and government that allows him to govern state and religion in harmony.

name: Liberal Majority
description: The liberal and progressive wing of the OSP coalition, led by Prince Sabahattin and his democratic ally Kazim Karabekir, is, unlike the conservatives, not opposed to Ataturk's reforms. According to them, the empire needs a progressive reorientation, but should remain evolutionary and democratic in nature. They advocate the institution of reforms such as women's suffrage and public schools.

name: Pursue the Adoption of the Swiss Civil Code
description: The Swiss civil code was a possibility that the OHF government wanted to adopt because of its modern and secular character. For the progressists it is the perfect opportunity to establish more equality in the empire, especially regarding the Christian minorities.

name: Equality Before the Law
description: Although the Ottoman constitution dictates the equality before the law for all Ottoman groups, regardless of religion or ethnicity, the empire remains heavily biased towards its Muslim majority, whose rights are better protected and catered to in all sections of the Ottoman bureaucracy. The Mecelle, based on the Sharia, stands as a key pillar within this and will need strong revision if true equality is to be achieved.

name: Promote Public Schools
description: Public schools are one of the reforms envisioned in what OHF called the Unification and Co-education reform. However, this act would be virtuous in the country, allowing to get closer to science without necessarily including religion in the school curriculum of the Turkish youth. Thus, students of different religions could be on the school benches on an equal footing.

name: Promote Political Sociology
description: Prince Sabahattin is a follower of the ideas of Emile Durkheim. Durkheim is the founder of sociology, the study of people, their relationships and society. The prince wished to import this 'science' into the Empire in order to participate in the education of the masses and improve the understanding of Ottoman society.

name: Establish Universal Suffrage
description: Universal suffrage is one of the main objectives of the great modern democracies. After having passed from the censal suffrage to the universal male suffrage, many think it's about time to extend it to the whole adult population. Knowing that many traditionalists are part of the coalition, this reform could draw the wrath of conservative parties but also the merits of progressives and former members of the OHF.

name: Financial Assistance for Anatolian Farmers
description: With the recent crises and wars, many crops were lost or destroyed and many farmers forced to take the road to flee from the advancing fronts. We should not forget that these peasants were one of Karabekir's main supporters during the election, making it our duty to assist them and to restore the agricultural economy of our country to its pre-war state.

name: Politicisation of the Masses
description: It is not enough to proclaim democracy for the country to be one! Kazim Karabekir asserts that, according to him, democracy belongs only to the elites who, with a minimum of political knowledge, go to the polls while the popular and illiterate classes are disinterested. In order to remedy this, it is necessary to launch vast campaigns with the intention of training people for the elections, and to explain them the reforms and ideas of the various parties.

name: Conservative Majority
description: The conservative wing of the OSP is composed of opponents of the OHF regime. Its leaders are from the Mohammedan Union, however they have sworn to defend democracy, and with the system of minimum deputies established by the provisional government, no party can take an absolute majority against the other two. Refet Pasha, the party's spiritual leader, cheered the victory.

name: Imperial Legacy
description: Now that the wave of authoritarian and reformist extremes has passed, we can finally assure that the empire will survive the centuries to come and will continue to evolve at its own pace accompanied by Islam, the religion of progress. For that, we have to thank our Sultan and his evolutionary ideals.

name: Restore Koranic Schools
description: Religious schools made private by the OHF should be reopened. Indeed, the Ottoman people, especially the illiterate population, tend to value religion as one of the highest goods. We can therefore deduce that they will have more confidence in sending their children to school despite the fact that some liberals consider such education to be superstitious.

name: Unite Tradition and Democracy
description: Islam is a learned religion. For many centuries, Arab and Turkish Muslim scholars were at the forefront of scientific progress. We must now seek to link Islam and democracy, which seems to be an easy task. To do this, some traditional codes need to evolve to fit modern times.

name: Restore the Property of the Sufi Orders
description: Sufist orders such as the Bektashis or the Mevlevis, known for their whirling dervishes, are ancestral orders that date back to the earliest traces of Islam in Anatolia. These orders, suppressed and mistreated by the OHF government, should be compensated for this period of persecution. Furthermore, the peaceful monasteries that were taken away from them must be returned.

name: Use the Tarikats
description: The Tarikats are one of the few organised Muslim institutions in the empire, kept in the background during the authoritarian periods. They were notably a vehicle for vertical social mobility, in fact everyone, from a simple peasant to the sultan himself, could be a member of a Tarikat. In addition, they used educational and social roles. By installing them in the provinces, we can use them for political and social purposes.

name: Redistribute State Property
description: Although the ideas of private land ownership were introduced into the Ottoman Empire during the 19th century and land redistribution was performed, large parts of the empire still remain either state or direct royal property. This absence of private land tenure decreases production, which brings despotism since there is no cause for people to work. As the liberals believe that humanity needs freedom to succeed, we must open these lands to private individuals.

name: Redistribute the Zakat
description: The Sultan is the head of state and of religion. The charity of Zakât al Maal, which is paid annually by Muslims, must be returned to the state. Thereafter, the state will form redistribution colleges, that will work in collaboration with imams and muftis in order to distribute the wealth in the best possible way in accordance with the Islamic virtues.

name: A Free Economy
description: Now that the Empire is limited to Anatolia, we are separated from a good part of our less developed lands. Perhaps we can bring in the laws of the free market and competition in order to open the Empire to the world market and allow the Turkish people to give the best of themselves.

name: Repeal the National Protection Law
description: Autarky was one of the pillars of the OHF's economic policy, but it did not help the empire to develop sufficiently by isolating it. We must remove all traces of this protectionism in order to better open the economy to the world.

name: Protect Private Properties
description: With the nationalisations carried out by the state in recent decades and the flight of foreign investors during the Weltkrieg, the place of private property seems to be questioned. Let's reassure the investors by proving the stability of the Anatolian economy and by signing assurances on their investments. Even the smallest peasant should be assured that his business will remain his own.

name: Develop the Major Trade Cities
description: Globalisation is now by sea, and Anatolia is ideally situated in the Mediterranean Sea, at the crossroads between the Black Sea, the Orient and Europe. Many goods and resources from Asia pass through our ports. Moreover, with the seizure of the Suez Canal by the Egyptians, we must seek to compete with them. This measure could bring us significantly closer to France.

name: The [ROOT.Capital.GetCapitalVictoryPointName] Stock Exchange
description: Stock exchanges seem to be the new factor of exchange between companies and individuals. Despite their failures in the US and during Black Monday, we need to create an intermediary in [ROOT.Capital.GetCapitalVictoryPointName] to facilitate the exchange between Europe and Asia.

name: Prioritise Foreign Investments
description: Some foreign companies seek to relocate or outsource to Anatolia because of the price of our labour or our climate. We can use these comparative advantages to develop and enrich our economy.

name: An Industrial Loan
description: We need to improve our civil industry to remain in the global market. This would improve both the living conditions of our citizens and our economy in general. For this purpose, Fatin Rüştü Bey has proposed to issue a loan in a large European bank to finance our work.

name: Reinvigorate Turkish Coffee Culture
description: Turkish coffee culture is internationally recognised, and our history is linked to it. We could develop our 'soft power' by using the image of traditional coffee while pushing it to a luxury product needed for European trade fairs. Some companies could be used as a basis for this development.

name: World-Class Coffee Exports
description: Our endeavours to explore new markets and to bring the entire world the delight that is Turkish coffee have been successful thus far, and the demand for this traditional beverage is continuously increasing. This is something we should capitalise on by increasing the quantity and quality of our coffee production and by fostering the growth of Turkish coffee companies.

name: Cutting the Euphrates Basin
description: The Euphrates River has its sources in our land. There are no international regulations regarding the exploitation of a river, and we are emerging from an armed conflict with Arab countries. By building and using the hydroelectric power of this river on a massive scale, we could both develop the region enormously and undermine the cultures of our enemies in the Middle East.

name: Anatolian Railway Project
description: Anatolia's rail lines, although improved since the Weltkrieg, are still quite precarious compared to Europe and neighbouring countries. In order to develop them, we need to have recourse to foreign investors, just like we did in the 19th century.

name: Develop the Berlin-Basra Railway
description: The Orient Express was built at the beginning of the 20th century. Its purpose was to link Paris, Vienna and other major European capitals to Constantinople. However, with the birth of the French Commune and German hegemony, the line now mainly connects Berlin to [ROOT.Capital.GetCapitalVictoryPointName].

name: Military-Industrial Contracts
description: With war, military companies are the ones who get richer. In addition, the powers that be are constantly looking for contracts to develop other countries in exchange for money during this war. We need to redevelop our war industry to prepare for the next war.

name: Reorganise Ottoman Military
description: The Ottoman army is totally destroyed morally. Even though the Weltkrieg was a victory, our army has been on the verge of collapse since the beginning of the century. Many generals see our armed forces as the greatest weakness of the nation, proven by their inability to resist the Arab rebels. We must reorganise them from top to bottom.

name: Increase Military Budget
description: Since the start of the growth period, we can afford to increase the military budget. We will need this budget to recover and modernise the army, be it for defensive purposes or for reconquest.

name: Create a Modern Turkish Fleet
description: To defend our trade and intimidate opponents we must invest in warships. The largest ships have proven to be the most effective against regional powers such as Egypt or Syria, which only possess ridiculous flotillas.

name: Learn From Our Failure
description: The war against the Cairo Pact was a failure, but some Turks even consider the Weltkrieg a failure. Despite some iconic victories at Çanakkale, Kut and Maraş, our troops were disorganised, and without German and Austrian help we would not have survived. Because we didn't learn from our mistakes, the empire was devastated by the Arabs. From now on, we must learn from our defeats to ensure victory.

name: Reform the Ottoman Gendarmerie
description: The Ottoman Gendarmerie was reformed in 1913 by the CUP to combat bandits crossing Anatolia, making it a military police force. However, since then, it has evolved little to remain a force for the protection of the countryside. We need to improve and expand the gendarmerie so that it can once again be used to its full potential and trained to respect the laws.

name: Modernise Soldier Equipment
description: Equipment is the key to our army and the engine of our soldiers. The British General Allenby said "Turkish soldiers are very brave, they love their homeland and they do not hesitate to give their lives for it if necessary". Yet what good is bravery if it is in vain? By equipping our divisions with modern weapons and armoured vehicles, we can honour the soldiers who fell on the fields of the Caucasus and the Middle East.

name: An Army Back on the World Stage
description: The Ottoman army is finally ready to play an international role again. After being reorganised and modernised, it will be able to face our enemies and defend the homeland for good. The Arab bandits should beware.
